column4: if i encrypted my hard drive when I install ubuntu 9.04 and now want to install 9.10, would there be a problem if I did not want my home partition to be reformated?
if i encrypted my hard drive when I install ubuntu 9.04 and now want to install 9.10, would there be a problem if I did not want my home partition to be reformated?
if you encryted your home then you must have a backup of it so go and upgrade
if i want to do a fresh install w/o deleting my /home partition.
i cant remember when i re-formated my home.....never do that
my home is on another disk
I don't want to reformat my /home. I just want to reformat the other partition.
rictec; I have only one disk on my laptop.
i never do that since 7.10 i think
is /home on another partition?
yes
then dont reformat
I just want to clean it up
I just want to reformat the other partition.
you canot go two ways at the same time
save that you really need from /home and burn it down lol
but if I do reformat the other partition except for my /home partition and the /home partition is encrypted, will everything be ok? that is the quesstion,.
i thin it will
i dont really know why the home is encrypted but if files are important you have a backup right?
another reason for doing this is because every once i a while I get a read-only system on my harddrive.
yes, I have an external harddrive that I back up my stuff to.
check smartdrive is enable on bios of the machine is a early warning of hard disk going bananas
